intro: Johnsonia hirta, commonly known as the woolly Johnsonia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Johnsonia hirta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and rocky areas.
